title: Javascript API monitor functions don't work
body:
### **Describe the bug**
In the window API, the [`currentMonitor()`, `primaryMonitor()` and `availableMonitors()` functions](https://github.com/tauri-apps/tauri/blob/70a1941468f55f0dc09ac2e13802945891d766f4/tooling/api/src/window.ts#L1162-L1196) don't work. They call an incorrect command from the JS side which causes an error.

### **To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. In a project with the JS API enabled, use any of the above functions.
2. See an error in the Javascript console:
  > unknown variant `primaryMonitor`, expected `createWebview` or `manage`

### **Additional context**
These three functions are standalone functions and call a top-level Tauri command, which is expected to be a variant of [the `Cmd` enum](https://github.com/tauri-apps/tauri/blob/70a1941468f55f0dc09ac2e13802945891d766f4/core/tauri/src/endpoints/window.rs#L88-L96). But these commands are actually [in the `WindowManagerCmd` enum](https://github.com/tauri-apps/tauri/blob/70a1941468f55f0dc09ac2e13802945891d766f4/core/tauri/src/endpoints/window.rs#L52-L54) and should be invoked with a window label. 

So I think a fix would be to move all three of these functions into the `WebviewWindow` class and call them with the current window label as a window command. Unless the `availableMonitors()` and `primaryMonitor()` functions should be standalone commands, in which case the Rust side will need to be updated to accept these as a top-level command.

### **Platform and Versions (required):**
```
Operating System - Windows, version 10.0.19042 X64
Webview2 - 92.0.902.55

Node.js environment
  Node.js - 14.16.0
  @tauri-apps/cli - 1.0.0-beta.6
  @tauri-apps/api - 1.0.0-beta.5

Global packages
  npm - 6.14.11
  yarn - 1.22.4

Rust environment
  rustc - 1.53.0
  cargo - 1.53.0

App directory structure
/.idea
/.nuxt
/assets
/components
/i18n
/layouts
/mixins
/node_modules
/pages
/plugins
/src-tauri
/static
/types
/utils

App
  tauri.rs - 1.0.0-beta.5
  build-type - bundle
  CSP - default-src blob: data: filesystem: ws: wss: http: https: tauri:
'unsafe-eval' 'unsafe-inline' 'self' img-src: 'self'
  distDir - ../dist
  devPath - http://localhost:3000
  framework - Vue.js (Nuxt)
  bundler - Webpack
```
